name: Data Analyst
description:
Lavin Media builds exceptional marketing solutions for large partners in the home improvement industry. We don’t just advertise our clients’ products or services — we build exceptional long-term marketing solutions within the context of permanent partnerships. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading services and customer experiences. We invite you to join us on that journey!

LM is looking to hire an outstanding data analyst with strong technical & business analytical skills to support the efforts for scalable data integration of internal and client process data. This includes analyzing data sources, measuring impact, identifying anomalies, and experimenting with data to drive improvements. This person will collaborate very closely and cross-functionally with Project Management, Media Buying, Finance, IT, and Design teams to ensure success.

Job Description:

  • Create, analyze, and present reports in Tableau, utilizing various data sources
  • Identify patterns from data anomalies to help improve data quality
  • Develop and maintain processes that help achieve maximum data accuracy and integrity
  • Identify opportunities for process automation
  • Collaborate cross-functionally across multiple teams (Media, CRO, IT)
  • Assist with feature build, execution, and rollout across teams
  • Create clear and concise documentation
Key Qualifications:

  • University degree in business administration, business analytics, or related field

  • 3+ years relevant work experience (analytics)

  • 1+ years of experience with Tableau, MicroStrategy, Microsoft BI, or similar data analytics software

  • English proficiency

  • Expert level in Excel

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Strong communication skills and ability to work closely with others

  • Demonstrated ability to work with multiple teams to complete critical achievements under pressure with tight deadlines

  • Team player personality

  • Time management and focus on results

Nice to Have:

  • Digital marketing experience

  • Experience with Google Analytics

  • Proficiency with relational databases

  • Data modeling

  • 1 + year in SQL/R/SAS and/or Python.

What we offer:

  • Full-time employment

  • Highly competitive compensation

  • Paid Vacation

  • Benefits

  • Work-life balance

  • Flexible schedule

  • Remote work

  • International network
